laboratory_examinations.findings: No pleural effusions. Mild fatty change involving the liver parenchyma. No focal lesions. Mild peripancreatic edema and subtle enhancement of the peripancreatic fat at the tail suggestive of focal changes. The pancreatic duct is normal in caliber measuring 3 mm. Multiple filling defects within the gallbladder indicative of calculi. Asymmetric edema surrounding the gallbladder, no gallbladder distension. The common bile duct is normal in caliber measuring 6 mm maximally, no intrahepatic biliary dilatation. The spleen is normal in size measuring 11 cm, with a 4-mm splenunculus. Both kidneys normal in size, with normal adrenal glands. No pathologically enlarged lymph nodes. No free intraabdominal fluid. Limited views of bowel within normal limits. Normal marrow signal from the lower thoracic and upper lumbar vertebrae. No evidence of an anterior abdominal wall defect or hernia.
